channel.title: MS Paint > *
channel.description:
Paint is a skill, thought I'd share a whole portfolio of work with all of you GFX'ers.
If it's not by me, it's labelled, anything that doesn't fall into a folder called "by[Name]" is by me. The Xerxes series is out of date, I must do some more sometime, also pretty much all of them relate to people and events happening on IRC.
http://fpspro.net/g/index.php?album=Paint&sortby=name&order=asc
Enjoy my, and a few other peoples work. By the way don't call our work "immature" or not "funny", it's not necessarily the intention, we are capturing a specific moment in Internet history by using colours and styles that best represent the situation at the time. Any drab comments about our IRC community are useless, since many of these were done for a different communities IRC channel anyway.

item.title: MS Paint > *
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

How witty, brownsymcard. ;D

I thought some of them were funny (I don’t think I laughed, but I did smile at some!), and I was actually quite surprised as to how many I was able to understand. Usually the stuff on IRC is really personal and random- hard to get if you don’t go there often, or chat the chat.

Read full topic

item.title: MS Paint > *
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

See you got it exactly right in your image.

You take a moment of IRC and capture it as quickly as possible, all of what you see take around a minute or two.

Where are all the wangs (as you call them)?

I highly doubt the intention of these was for "capturing a specific moment in Internet history by using colours and styles that best represent the situation at the time"
That's exactly what they do, I disregard the rest of your post as useless blabber coming from an Artist who is more into fine art and stuff that looks good. Just because these images are crap, shitty and tacky and lack any form of moral humour does not mean they're useless, they just fail to impress you and that is all.

Read full topic

item.title: MS Paint > *
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

Far from “work” or “pieces”. I find them in extreme lack of humor. I fail to see the thought, or color meaning in any of these.

They look more like the crap toddlers make on paint when they first start using computers.

I highly doubt the intention of these was for “capturing a specific moment in Internet history by using colours and styles that best represent the situation at the time”.

The purpose of paint is for kids, not “deep thinkers”. Paint is used by “gfx’ers” to show skill, rarely for anything abstract in thought. If you want to show paint skill, dont scribble. When someone wants to make something cartoony, for the sake of meaning, they should atleast use something that has automatic AA, or atleast take their time to make it look nice in paint.

We both agree on paint being a skill, but of definitions of skill are the difference between an 8yr olds notebook doodle, and photo-realistic Chuck Close paintings.

EDIT: And whats with the strange addiction to wangs in all of them?

EDIT: Let me capture this moment of the web on paint.


Took me long hours of pondering… (About 2 seconds of thought, then another 5 in paint).

Read full topic
